RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THREE DAY BENDER away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of DEANARROW in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, shook clear of his pace rival leaving the the turn and drew clear in the lane under confident handling. DEANARROW broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue from the outside of THREE DAY BENDER in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, and finished two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. MEMORANDUM tracked the leaders from along the rail in the run down the backside, commenced his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on the pacesetters entering the final turn, and needed more over the final furlong while holding on for a share. DAPPER DON settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly three wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. BECKAS BOY settled well off the early leaders while racing three wide in the run down the backside, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Memorandum
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Three Day Bender
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Deanarrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Dapper Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Beckas Boy
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, no factor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 8 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IRISH LUNA hopped at the start, but recovered quickly and tracked the pacesetter into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, maintained her tracking trip through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and inched clear late to prove best. ZETAMARIE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, eased off the rail entering the lane, and closed determinedly two wide in the drive to get up for the place in the closing strides. SILK STILETTOS away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the second turn and in the run down the backstretch, maintained her advantage into the final turn, was collared and quickly overtaken entering the lane, and just failed to hold the place. PINEAPPLE TIDBITS broke sharply, but was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but needed more when called on in an even effort. QUEEN OF LOVE away alertly, but was taken in hand and allowed to settle off the early pace, dropped back to trail entering the final turn, and failed to respond when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, trailed, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Tidbits
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Zetamarie
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Silk Stilettos
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Luna
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, led, inched clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 21000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE OF $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2, 500 To $20,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMART LAD broke sharply, but was taken in hand and allowed to settle off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, took control leaving the final turn, and quickly opened a clear lead, and held SET TO SHINE safely at bay late. SET TO SHINE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly two out from the rail in the lane while gaining late to prove easily second best. BOLD ARCH dueled for the lead from the outside of BELCARRA PARK entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside, took a narrow lead into the final turn, was overtaken leaving the turn, and faded in the stretch drive. BELCARRA PARK away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch, struggled to keep pace with her pace rival entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Set to Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Lad
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2w, rallied 3w, led, held

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Kenneth L. Ramsey & Sarah K. Ramsey

ENTRY.NAME: Belcarra Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Arch
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrison, John and Kim and Sadler, Robin
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, late fade

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AZOV SEA broke sharply and pressed the pace from the outside of MY MAN STAN in the run down the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide through the final turn and into the stretch, and prevailed over that determined rival following a stretch long battle. MY MAN STAN away well and raced to a narrow advantage from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and just missed following a stretch long battled. ENGLISH BAY TEDDY tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. BARBERRY BANDIT hopped at the start to get away slowly and trailed the field into the backstretch, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. SHOWMAN away alertly and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. UNION MAN tracked the dueling leaders while racing from between rivals entering the backstretch, maintained a striking position to the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Showman
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked inside, rallied rail, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Barberry Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Union Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: My Man Stan
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing Eugene Chan and Breen Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: English Bay Teddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Azov Sea
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, prevailed

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: T & G Farm of Kentucky, LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 17000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $1 2,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOALA away alertly and pressed the pace from the outside of ALOBRA entering the backstretch, began to get the better of her pace rival midway down the backside, opened a clear lead entering the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. BELLAROO settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, launched her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to get the place. QUEEN OF ATTITUDE hesitated at the start, and broke inwards at the start causing her rider to briefly lose his inside iron, trailed the field into the backstretch, rallied two wide from between rivals entering the final turn, while steadying off heels throughout the turn, found clear sailing three wide entering the lane, and closed with a rush to garner a share. LASTING LIGHT broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the contested early pace while racing three wide entering the backstretch, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, was carried five wide entering the lane, and finished evenly four out from the rail in the drive. ALOBRAH away well and raced to a narrow advantage from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressure pace from along the rail into the backstretch, was unable to keep tabs on her pace rival in the run to the final turn, and faded over the final furlong. NINE OCLOCK CEASER tracked the leaders into the backstretch while briefly steadying while in tight quarters, rallied two wide entering the final turn, drifted wide leaving the turn while carrying LASTING LIGHT out with her, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Bellaroo
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Nine Oclock Ceaser
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Alobrah
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Koala
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2w, led, clear lead, held

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated start, trailed, rallied 2w, steadied 1/4, closed 3 wide

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DRILL BABY DRILL stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied smartly one out from the rail through the final turn, assumed command entering the lane, and inched clear late while drifting four wide in deep stretch. STRIKING VALUE was off a step slow, and settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly one out from the rail in the drive to get up for the place in the final strides. SHE'S ON FIRE away well and stalked the leader into the backside while racing two out from the rail, continued three wide into the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. BEST ONE YET settled off the early pace while racing four wide into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished with some late interest six wide in the drive. LILSISTERLEE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was collared leaving the turn, and faded in the stretch drive. BETTER WITH TIME broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn while struggling to hold her position, checked slightly leaving the turn, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Lilsisterlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Better With Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Best One Yet
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: She's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000., For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEXAS HUMOR away well and stalked the early pacesetters while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide through the final turn, and closed steadily four wide in the lane to get up in time. PERFECT PENNY stalked the dueling leaders into the backside while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to just miss. THESKYISTHELIMIT raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of GWEN entering the backside, took command midway down the backstretch and opened a clear advantage into the final turn, maintained her lead into the lane, and gave way grudgingly late while holding on for a share. ROSE OF TEXAS broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing three out from the rail, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and improved her position in the late stages while finishing four wide in the drive. GWEN pressed the pace from the outside of THESKYISTHELIMIT entering the backstretch, was unable to match strides with her pace rival in the run to the final turn, rallied two wide through the final turn, but needed more in the late going. STAR FINALITY away alertly and eased into a stalking trip while racing one out from the rail through the first turn, maintained a stalking trip from between rivals in the run to the final turn, rallied two wide through the final turn, but failed to respond when called upon. STOPSHOPPINGSHELLY settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside, continued to save ground into the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid when called upon. LIL'MISS INTAGLIO dwelt at the start, to get away poorly, trailed well behind the field entering the backstretch, and wasn't persevered with over the final furlong while hopelessly beat. Following the running of this race the stewards conducted an inquiry into the start of the race, in particular to LIL'MISS INTAGLIO. After review it was deemed that all horses received a fair start, and that LIL"MISS INTAGLIO caused her own problems at the gate, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 w, rallied 3 w, closed 4 w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Stopshoppingshelly
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Theskyisthelimit
ENTRY.OWNER: Dreamtime Stable Clark Heather and Beneen Greg
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, clear lead, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Lil'miss Intaglio
ENTRY.COMMENT: dwelt start, trailed throughout, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Gwen
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Star Finality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response
